info.description:
The WorkDocs API is designed for the following use cases:

  • File Migration: File migration applications are supported for users who want to migrate their files from an on-premises or off-premises file system or service. Users can insert files into a user directory structure, as well as allow for basic metadata changes, such as modifications to the permissions of files.

  • Security: Support security applications are supported for users who have additional security needs, such as antivirus or data loss prevention. The API actions, along with AWS CloudTrail, allow these applications to detect when changes occur in Amazon WorkDocs. Then, the application can take the necessary actions and replace the target file. If the target file violates the policy, the application can also choose to email the user.

  • eDiscovery/Analytics: General administrative applications are supported, such as eDiscovery and analytics. These applications can choose to mimic or record the actions in an Amazon WorkDocs site, along with AWS CloudTrail, to replicate data for eDiscovery, backup, or analytical applications.

All Amazon WorkDocs API actions are Amazon authenticated and certificate-signed. They not only require the use of the AWS SDK, but also allow for the exclusive use of IAM users and roles to help facilitate access, trust, and permission policies. By creating a role and allowing an IAM user to access the Amazon WorkDocs site, the IAM user gains full administrative visibility into the entire Amazon WorkDocs site (or as set in the IAM policy). This includes, but is not limited to, the ability to modify file permissions and upload any file to any user. This allows developers to perform the three use cases above, as well as give users the ability to grant access on a selective basis using the IAM model.
info.title: Amazon WorkDocs

get.description: Describes the user activities in a specified time period.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The timestamp that determines the starting time of the activities. The response includes the activities performed after the specified timestamp.
parameters.name: startTime

parameters.description: The timestamp that determines the end time of the activities. The response includes the activities performed before the specified timestamp.
parameters.name: endTime

parameters.description: The ID of the organization. This is a mandatory parameter when using administrative API (SigV4) requests.
parameters.name: organizationId

parameters.description: Specifies which activity types to include in the response. If this field is left empty, all activity types are returned.
parameters.name: activityTypes

parameters.description: The document or folder ID for which to describe activity types.
parameters.name: resourceId

parameters.description: The ID of the user who performed the action. The response includes activities pertaining to this user. This is an optional parameter and is only applicable for administrative API (SigV4) requests.
parameters.name: userId

parameters.description: Includes indirect activities. An indirect activity results from a direct activity performed on a parent resource. For example, sharing a parent folder (the direct activity) shares all of the subfolders and documents within the parent folder (the indirect activity).
parameters.name: includeIndirectActivities

parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The marker for the next set of results.
parameters.name: marker

post.description:
Creates a new document object and version object.

The client specifies the parent folder ID and name of the document to upload. The ID is optionally specified when creating a new version of an existing document. This is the first step to upload a document. Next, upload the document to the URL returned from the call, and then call UpdateDocumentVersion.

To cancel the document upload, call AbortDocumentVersionUpload.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

ContentCreatedTimestamp.description: The timestamp when the content of the document was originally created.

ContentModifiedTimestamp.description: The timestamp when the content of the document was modified.

ContentType.description: The content type of the document.

DocumentSizeInBytes.description: The size of the document, in bytes.

ParentFolderId.description: The ID of the parent folder.

delete.description: Permanently deletes the specified document and its associated metadata.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The ID of the document.
parameters.name: DocumentId

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The ID of the document.
parameters.name: DocumentId

parameters.description: Set this to TRUE to include custom metadata in the response.
parameters.name: includeCustomMetadata

patch.description: Updates the specified attributes of a document. The user must have access to both the document and its parent folder, if applicable.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The ID of the document.
parameters.name: DocumentId

ParentFolderId.description: The ID of the parent folder.

ResourceState.description: The resource state of the document. Only ACTIVE and RECYCLED are supported.

get.description:
Retrieves the path information (the hierarchy from the root folder) for the requested document.

By default, Amazon WorkDocs returns a maximum of 100 levels upwards from the requested document and only includes the IDs of the parent folders in the path. You can limit the maximum number of levels. You can also request the names of the parent folders.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The ID of the document.
parameters.name: DocumentId

parameters.description: The maximum number of levels in the hierarchy to return.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of values. Specify NAME to include the names of the parent folders.
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: This value is not supported.
parameters.name: marker

get.description:
Retrieves the document versions for the specified document.

By default, only active versions are returned.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The ID of the document.
parameters.name: DocumentId

parameters.description: The marker for the next set of results. (You received this marker from a previous call.)
parameters.name: marker

parameters.description: The maximum number of versions to return with this call.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of values. Specify "INITIALIZED" to include incomplete versions.
parameters.name: include

parameters.description: Specify "SOURCE" to include initialized versions and a URL for the source document.
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: Pagination limit
parameters.name: Limit

parameters.description: Pagination token
parameters.name: Marker

delete.description: Aborts the upload of the specified document version that was previously initiated by InitiateDocumentVersionUpload. The client should make this call only when it no longer intends to upload the document version, or fails to do so.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The ID of the document.
parameters.name: DocumentId

parameters.description: The ID of the version.
parameters.name: VersionId

get.description: Retrieves version metadata for the specified document.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The ID of the document.
parameters.name: DocumentId

parameters.description: The version ID of the document.
parameters.name: VersionId

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of values. Specify "SOURCE" to include a URL for the source document.
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: Set this to TRUE to include custom metadata in the response.
parameters.name: includeCustomMetadata

patch.description:
Changes the status of the document version to ACTIVE.

Amazon WorkDocs also sets its document container to ACTIVE. This is the last step in a document upload, after the client uploads the document to an S3-presigned URL returned by InitiateDocumentVersionUpload.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The ID of the document.
parameters.name: DocumentId

parameters.description: The version ID of the document.
parameters.name: VersionId

post.description: Adds a new comment to the specified document version.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The ID of the document.
parameters.name: DocumentId

parameters.description: The ID of the document version.
parameters.name: VersionId

NotifyCollaborators.description: Set this parameter to TRUE to send an email out to the document collaborators after the comment is created.

ParentId.description: The ID of the parent comment.

ThreadId.description: The ID of the root comment in the thread.

Visibility.description: The visibility of the comment. Options are either PRIVATE, where the comment is visible only to the comment author and document owner and co-owners, or PUBLIC, where the comment is visible to document owners, co-owners, and contributors.

delete.description: Deletes the specified comment from the document version.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The ID of the document.
parameters.name: DocumentId

parameters.description: The ID of the document version.
parameters.name: VersionId

parameters.description: The ID of the comment.
parameters.name: CommentId

get.description: List all the comments for the specified document version.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The ID of the document.
parameters.name: DocumentId

parameters.description: The ID of the document version.
parameters.name: VersionId

parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The marker for the next set of results. This marker was received from a previous call.
parameters.name: marker

post.description: Creates a folder with the specified name and parent folder.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

Name.description: The name of the new folder.

ParentFolderId.description: The ID of the parent folder.

delete.description: Permanently deletes the specified folder and its contents.

parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The ID of the folder.

parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.name: FolderId

parameters.description: Set to TRUE to include custom metadata in the response.

patch.description: Updates the specified attributes of the specified folder. The user must have access to both the folder and its parent folder, if applicable.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The ID of the folder.
parameters.name: FolderId

ParentFolderId.description: The ID of the parent folder.

ResourceState.description: The resource state of the folder. Only ACTIVE and RECYCLED are accepted values from the API.

delete.description: Deletes the contents of the specified folder.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The ID of the folder.
parameters.name: FolderId

get.description:
Describes the contents of the specified folder, including its documents and subfolders.

By default, Amazon WorkDocs returns the first 100 active document and folder metadata items. If there are more results, the response includes a marker that you can use to request the next set of results. You can also request initialized documents.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The ID of the folder.
parameters.name: FolderId

parameters.description: The sorting criteria.
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: The order for the contents of the folder.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return with this call.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The marker for the next set of results. This marker was received from a previous call.
parameters.name: marker

parameters.description: The type of items.
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: The contents to include. Specify "INITIALIZED" to include initialized documents.
parameters.name: include

parameters.description: Pagination limit
parameters.name: Limit

parameters.description: Pagination token
parameters.name: Marker

get.description:
Retrieves the path information (the hierarchy from the root folder) for the specified folder.

By default, Amazon WorkDocs returns a maximum of 100 levels upwards from the requested folder and only includes the IDs of the parent folders in the path. You can limit the maximum number of levels. You can also request the parent folder names.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The ID of the folder.
parameters.name: FolderId

parameters.description: The maximum number of levels in the hierarchy to return.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of values. Specify "NAME" to include the names of the parent folders.
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: This value is not supported.
parameters.name: marker

get.description: Describes the groups specified by the query. Groups are defined by the underlying Active Directory.

parameters.name: searchQuery

parameters.description: The ID of the organization.
parameters.name: organizationId

parameters.description: The marker for the next set of results. (You received this marker from a previous call.)

parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return with this call.

get.description: Retrieves details of the current user for whom the authentication token was generated. This is not a valid action for SigV4 (administrative API) clients.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

get.description:
Describes the current user's special folders; the RootFolder and the RecycleBin. RootFolder is the root of user's files and folders and RecycleBin is the root of recycled items. This is not a valid action for SigV4 (administrative API) clients.

This action requires an authentication token. To get an authentication token, register an application with Amazon WorkDocs. For more information, see Authentication and Access Control for User Applications in the Amazon WorkDocs Developer Guide.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The marker for the next set of results. (You received this marker from a previous call.)
parameters.name: marker

parameters.description: The ID of the organization.
parameters.name: OrganizationId

parameters.description: The marker for the next set of results. (You received this marker from a previous call.)
parameters.name: marker

parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return with this call.
parameters.name: limit

post.description:
Configure Amazon WorkDocs to use Amazon SNS notifications. The endpoint receives a confirmation message, and must confirm the subscription.

For more information, see Subscribe to Notifications in the Amazon WorkDocs Developer Guide.

parameters.description: The ID of the organization.
parameters.name: OrganizationId

Endpoint.description: The endpoint to receive the notifications. If the protocol is HTTPS, the endpoint is a URL that begins with https.

Protocol.description: The protocol to use. The supported value is https, which delivers JSON-encoded messages using HTTPS POST.

delete.description: Deletes the specified subscription from the specified organization.

parameters.description: The ID of the subscription.
parameters.name: SubscriptionId

parameters.description: The ID of the organization.
parameters.name: OrganizationId

get.description: Retrieves a collection of resources, including folders and documents. The only CollectionType supported is SHARED_WITH_ME.

parameters.description: The Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API operation using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The user ID for the resource collection. This is a required field for accessing the API operation using IAM credentials.
parameters.name: userId

parameters.description: The collection type.
parameters.name: collectionType

parameters.description: The maximum number of resources to return.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The marker for the next set of results. This marker was received from a previous call.
parameters.name: marker

parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The ID of the resource, either a document or folder.

parameters.description: The ID of the version, if the custom metadata is being deleted from a document version.

parameters.description: List of properties to remove.

parameters.description: Flag to indicate removal of all custom metadata properties from the specified resource.

parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The ID of the resource.

parameters.description: The ID of the version, if the custom metadata is being added to a document version.
parameters.name: versionid

CustomMetadata.description: Custom metadata in the form of name-value pairs.

delete.description: Deletes the specified list of labels from a resource.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.

parameters.description: List of labels to delete from the resource.
parameters.name: labels

parameters.description: Flag to request removal of all labels from the specified resource.

parameters.name: ResourceId

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.

Labels.description: List of labels to add to the resource.

get.description:
Describes the specified users. You can describe all users or filter the results (for example, by status or organization).

By default, Amazon WorkDocs returns the first 24 active or pending users. If there are more results, the response includes a marker that you can use to request the next set of results.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

parameters.description: The ID of the organization.
parameters.name: organizationId

parameters.description: The IDs of the users.
parameters.name: userIds

parameters.description: A query to filter users by user name.
parameters.name: query

parameters.description: The state of the users. Specify "ALL" to include inactive users.
parameters.name: include

parameters.description: The order for the results.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: The sorting criteria.
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: The marker for the next set of results. (You received this marker from a previous call.)
parameters.name: marker

parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of values. Specify "STORAGE_METADATA" to include the user storage quota and utilization information.
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: Pagination limit
parameters.name: Limit

parameters.description: Pagination token
parameters.name: Marker

post.description: Creates a user in a Simple AD or Microsoft AD directory. The status of a newly created user is "ACTIVE". New users can access Amazon WorkDocs.

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication

EmailAddress.description: The email address of the user.

GivenName.description: The given name of the user.

StorageRule.description: Describes the storage for a user.

TimeZoneId.description: The time zone ID of the user.

Username.description: The login name of the user.

delete.description: Deletes the specified user from a Simple AD or Microsoft AD directory.

parameters.description: The ID of the user.

GivenName.description: The given name of the user.

GrantPoweruserPrivileges.description: Boolean value to determine whether the user is granted Poweruser privileges.

StorageRule.description: Describes the storage for a user.

TimeZoneId.description: The time zone ID of the user.

delete.description: Deactivates the specified user, which revokes the user's access to Amazon WorkDocs.

parameters.description: The ID of the user.
parameters.name: UserId

parameters.description: Amazon WorkDocs authentication token. Do not set this field when using administrative API actions, as in accessing the API using AWS credentials.
parameters.name: Authentication
